citations.narrative:
The licensee is exhibiting and providing public interactions with two spider monkeys. The current license does not permit
covered activity with these primates. Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of
regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting). Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of group 6 non-human
primates, which includes spider monkey species.
The licensee must either remove these animals from exhibition permanently or obtain a new license which authorizes the
use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit this animal.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(ii) 
   
Requirements and application 
The licensee is exhibiting and providing public interactions with two spider monkeys. The current license does not permit 
covered activity with these primates. Licenses authorize a specific number and specific type(s) of animals for the use of 
regulated activity (i.e., exhibiting). Licensure with the USDA must specifically authorize the use of group 6 non-human 
primates, which includes spider monkey species. 
 
The licensee must either remove these animals from exhibition permanently or obtain a new license which authorizes the 
use of this category of animal before continuing to exhibit this animal. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
KRISTIN NAPOLI, SUPERVISORY ANIMAL CARE SPECIALIST n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
